intro: Hieracium cryptanthum, commonly known as the cryptanthum hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium cryptanthum is known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments and is often found in temperate climates.
